author: jhkimnew
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

This repository is **ONLY** for PowerShell Core 6 issues.

- Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6?view=powershell-6).

-->

# Steps to reproduce

```
1.	Install 19h1 OS where we made IISAdministration module to be compatible to Powershell Core
2.	Install IIS
3.	Enable sshd feature with running below powershell commands:
Add-WindowsCapability -Online -Name OpenSSH.Server~~~~0.0.1.0
Set-Service -Name sshd -StartupType 'Automatic' 
Start-Service sshd
4.	Update the existing Subsystem setting of \ProgramData\ssh\sshd_config file as the following:
#Subsystem              sftp          sftp-server.exe
Subsystem powershell               pwsh.exe -NoLogo -NoProfile -sshs
5.	Restart sshd service 
6.	Install Powershell Core
7.	Start Powershell Core and then import iisadministration module via ssh remoting with running below commands:
Pwsh.exe
Enter-PSSession -HostName localhost -UserName administrator
Import-module iisadministration -verbose
```

# Expected behavior

```
No error and Microsoft.IIS.Powershell.Commands.dll in GAC should not be loaded to pwsh.exe process and the Microsoft.IIS.Powershell.Commands.dll in module directory should be used.
```

# Actual behavior

```
Import-module cmdlet shows  “Assembly with same name is already loaded” error message because Microsoft.IIS.Powershell.Commands.dll in GAC is loaded to pwsh.exe process. 

NOTE: 
1.	If you can’t reproduce in initial time, restart pwsh.exe and try again and you will see the issue. 
FYI, sometimes, the issue is not reproducible in the first trial. I guess that it is because the Microsoft.IIS.Powershell.Commands.dll is not in GAC for the first trial.
2.	If we delete the Microsoft.IIS.Powershell.Commands.dll in GAC, the issue is gone. 
That means this issue happens because pwsh.exe loads Microsoft.IIS.Powershell.Commands.dll in GAC directory unexpectedly when it starts. 
You can confirm that that with attaching the pwsh process right after it starts or simply running “tlist -p <process id of pwsh>” command and you will see the GAC directory path as the following:
C:\> tlist 6904 
   6904 pwsh.exe
   CWD:     C:\WINDOWS\system32\
   CmdLine: pwsh
…
10.0.18890.1001 sh  0x000001F99B180000  C:\WINDOWS\Microsoft.NET\assembly\GAC_MSIL\Microsoft.IIS.Powershell.Commands\v4.0_10.0.0.0__31bf3856ad364e35\Microsoft.IIS.PowerShell.Commands.dll
…

```

# Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none

```

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @adityapatwardhan can you look at this one?

comments.author: adityapatwardhan
comments.body: @jhkimnew Could you confirm which PowerShell Core version you used?

comments.author: jhkimnew
comments.body:
@adityapatwardhan 

I used Powershell 6.2.0. I also sent a mail to you with the repro machine information so that you can reproduce the issue.

comments.author: jhkimnew
comments.body:
@chuanjiao10 Did you try more than one time? The issue is not reproducible in the first trial and so you would need to retry one more time with restarting pwsh.exe.

BTW, I used the built-in SSHD in OS, not public build of OpenSSH.

comments.author: jhkimnew
comments.body: @chuanjiao10 For some reasons, Microsoft.IIS.Powershell.Commands.dll in GAC is not loaded to pwsh.exe process and the problem is not reproducible. However, the issue happens when restarting pwsh.exe. That sounds strange but that is the symptom of this issue. BTW, I gave @adityapatwardhan the repro machine. So, he will be able to see the symptom of this issue. :-)

comments.author: adityapatwardhan
comments.body:
I investigated this issue and it is due to [StartupProfileOptimization](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.runtime.profileoptimization?view=netframework-4.8&viewFallbackFrom=netcore-2.1) done by dotnet. We need an ability to disable the profile optimization to avoid loading the assembly from GAC.

Details:

When we use the IISAdministration module in the SSH server, dotnet adds it to the profile optimization file. So when the next time the SSH server is started, it tries to load the DLL. Now since the PowerShell Module is not being loaded, we fallback to looking up the GAC for loading.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT @adityapatwardhan @anmenaga It seems it is something expected to being fixed for 7.0.

title: IISAdministration module fails to load under SSH remoting
